name: The Book of Eli
author: Warner Bros. Pictures
description: The Book of Eli is the quintessential apocalyptic film. It explores the journey of man through a merciless world post environmental disaster, attempting to complete what he believes to be a God-given mission to deliver a bible west. The film explores the abuse of power and religion in a world more or less void of religion.

name: The Seventh Seal
author: AB Svensk Filmindustri
description: The Seventh Seal shows the return journey of a crusader to a plague-stricken Europe. Throughout the film, different individuals continuously point to the plague as some sort of religious event, be it a punishment from God or the apocalypse.

name: The Day the Earth Stood Still
author: 20th Century Fox
description: The Day the Earth Stood Still stands unique of most apocalyptic films. It gives instead a warning of apocalypse by a Jesus-like figure, if humanity chooses to bring nuclear weapons to space. Similarities can be drawn to fears of nuclear destruction during the Cold War, a time when humanity was likely closest to extinction in recent history.

name: Apocalypse Now
author: United Artists
description: As decipherable from the title, Apocalypse Now explores an apocalyptic microcosm within the 1970s, instead of the stereotypical world in apocalypse. It follows a man’s journey through said apocalypse to accomplish a morally grey mission given to him by his superiors.

name: Independence Day
author: 20th Century Fox
description: As decipherable from the title, Apocalypse Now explores an apocalyptic microcosm within the 1970s, instead of the stereotypical world in apocalypse. It follows a man’s journey through said apocalypse to accomplish a morally grey mission given to him by his superiors.

name: Smoke Signals
author: Miramax
description: Smoke Signals takes a unique approach to the typical formula present in other post-apocalyptic films. Instead of a usually dystopian world with a broken natural environment, Smoke Signals exhibits a world of a specific people, post-conquest. It explores the lives of two individuals searching for a lost cultural identity.

name: Blade Runner
author: Warner Bros.
description: Blade Runner displays a dystopian world, in which Earth has long since been barren of all life but human. It explores the meaning of what it means to be human, and the morality of the control and limitation of other sentient, intelligent life.

name: Planet of the Apes
author: 20th Century Fox
description: The Planet of the Apes shows a world in recovery following what appears to be the destruction of modern humanity. Instead, intelligent non-human primates have taken the mantle as the planet’s dominant species. It explores the repetition of discrimination and other societal norms found in our society in another intelligent species.

name: 28 Days Later
author: Fox Searchlight Pictures
description: 28 Days Later envisions a Great Britain following a zombie apocalypse. A group of four characters attempt to make their way to a supposed safe haven at a military outpost. A near-complete dissolution of the government of Great Britain seems apparent, with no overall command structure for the British military remaining.
